alert.note: Alert for Wayne (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued March 31 at 2:47PM CDT until March 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 PM CDT FOR SOUTH CENTRAL MONROE...WEST CENTRAL DAVIS...EAST CENTRAL WAYNE AND APPANOOSE COUNTIES... At 247 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mystic, or near Centerville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Rathbun, Honey Creek State Park, Sharon Bluffs State Park, Udell, Lake Sundown, Moravia and Unionville. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM CDT for south central and southeastern Iowa. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
